alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Greensville; Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Greensville, west central Southampton, southwestern Sussex and east central Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 545 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lawrenceville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Radium around 515 PM EDT. Purdy around 520 PM EDT. Emporia around 525 PM EDT. Jarratt and Green Plain around 530 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ante, Adams Grove, Gray, Grizzard, Bufford Crossroads, Dolphin, Yale, Pleasant Shade, Fields Crossroads and Emporia Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
